meanings.definition: Capable of being decided or settled
meanings.sent1: The color of the car was decidable because it was either red or blue.
meanings.sent2: The decidable outcome of the game was whether the team would win or lose.
meanings.sent3: It was a decidable choice between ice cream and cake for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The decidable path to success was through hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The decidable solution to the problem was to ask for help when needed.

meanings.definition: Able to be determined or resolved
meanings.sent1: The decidable date for the meeting was set for next Monday.
meanings.sent2: The decidable answer to the math problem was found after careful calculation.
meanings.sent3: She had a decidable plan to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent4: The decidable way to reach the destination was by following the map.
meanings.sent5: The decidable decision to make was to choose the best option available.
